title: 11-year-old girl shot in Newburgh
content:
NEWBURGH >> An 11-year-old girl was shot Friday while getting out of a taxi on Benkard Avenue.
Newburgh City police said the shooting occurred at about 10:30 p.m. when an unknown shooter fired several shots from Liberty Street up Benkard Avenue.
The girl was struck once in the hip. Authorities said the injury was not life threatening and there were no other reported injuries.
In a press release, Police Chief Daniel Cameron asked that anyone with information about the shooting contact the Newburgh police.

“We cannot tolerate this violence in our community,” Cameron stated. “Having information and not reporting it is a form of accepting this violence.”
To report any information about the incident, call (845) 561-3131.
